cds::opt::value_cleaner< TYPE > Struct Template Reference

[type-option] value cleaning More...

#include <cds/opt/value_cleaner.h>

Detailed Description

template<typename TYPE>
struct cds::opt::value_cleaner< TYPE >

[type-option] value cleaning

The cleaner is a functor called when an item is removed from a container. Note, the cleaner should not delete (deallocate) the value val passed in. However, if the value_type type is a structure that contains dynamically allocated field(s), the cleaning functor may deallocate it and iniitalize to default value (usually, NULL).

The interface for type value_type is: 

        struct myCleaner {
            void operator ()( value_type& val )
            {
                ...
 code to cleanup \p val
            }
        }

Predefined option types:

  • opt::v::empty_cleaner
